intro: Vulpiella stipoides subsp. tenuis, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a grass species native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It is a low-growing perennial plant characterized by its fine, hair-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or grassland habitats. Its botanical features include a basal rosette of leaves and spikelets that are loosely arranged along the stem. Vulpiella stipoides subsp. tenuis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native environment.
